intro: [WRONG START] Astellia alpina var. novae-hollandiae, commonly known as the New Holland grass, is a low-growing perennial plant native to New Zealand. It features dense, upright clumps of narrow, grass-like leaves that are usually a bluish-green color. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained, sunny conditions and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover. Its hardy nature makes it suitable for coastal and alpine environments.
